20100: The DNSs you are using are wrong.

You can check all the available DNSs with `s!dns`. We recommended to use the server called `Wiimmfi`, because it is the most popular. `Wiimmfi 2`, even though having a different DNS, still connects to the same server, meaning you will find the same people who are using the `Wiimmfi` DNSs. Some people have noticed that they can connect successfully using the `Wiimmfi 2` DNSs but not to the `Wiimmfi` DNSs, so it might be worth checking that out if the main `Wiimmfi` DNSs do not work for you.
20102: Your WFC profile is banned from Wiimmfi.

To circumvent the ban you need to create a new profile. Follow these 2 steps to do so:
1. Load a game and enter the Wi-Fi Configuration Panel.
2. Go to `Options` and  select `Erase Nintendo WFC Configuration`.

Replace the Nintendo DS BIOS and Firmware files you are using. If you want to dump the one from your Nintendo DS, run this program on a flashcart (http://kuribo64.net/get.php?id=TWCJjwloQLCYy3Zh). If you want to dump your own from a Nintendo DSi, use this program instead (http://melonds.kuribo64.net/downloads/dsibiosdumper.7z).
Create a new save file or use another one.
20110: Your Network does not support custom DNSs.
Try setting the Secondary DNS to the Primary DNS of the server you are using and do not change the Primary DNS.
Fix 2 (TWiLight Menu++, Flashcart or Emulator only)

In case Fix 1 does not work, follow these two steps:
1. Patch your Mario Kart DS ROM with the WFC Patcher (https://github.com/AdmiralCurtiss/WfcPatcher/releases/tag/v1.6).
2. Set `95.217.77.151` as both Primary DNS and Secondary DNS.
23400: Your ROM is not patched correctly (if you are not using a patched ROM your ROM might be corrupted; if you are using an original cartridge then the cause of this is unknown).
Make sure you are using a fresh dump of the game and that you have patched a ROM that is not trimmed or corrputed.
23912: Your WFC profile is banned permanently from Wiimmfi.

To circumvent the ban you need to create a new profile. Follow these 2 steps to do so:
1. Load a game and enter the Wi-Fi Configuration Panel.
2. Go to `Options` and  select `Erase Nintendo WFC Configuration`.

Replace the Nintendo DS BIOS and Firmware files you are using. If you want to dump the one from your Nintendo DS, run this program on a flashcart (http://kuribo64.net/get.php?id=TWCJjwloQLCYy3Zh). If you want to dump your own from a Nintendo DSi, use this program instead (http://melonds.kuribo64.net/downloads/dsibiosdumper.7z).
Create a new save file or use another one.
23917: Your WFC profile is temporarily banned from Wiimmfi.

To circumvent the ban you need to create a new profile. Follow these 2 steps to do so:
1. Load a game and enter the Wi-Fi Configuration Panel.
2. Go to `Options` and  select `Erase Nintendo WFC Configuration`.

Replace the Nintendo DS BIOS and Firmware files you are using. If you want to dump the one from your Nintendo DS, run this program on a flashcart (http://kuribo64.net/get.php?id=TWCJjwloQLCYy3Zh). If you want to dump your own from a Nintendo DSi, use this program instead (http://melonds.kuribo64.net/downloads/dsibiosdumper.7z).
Create a new save file or use another one.

Wait for the ban to expire. Some bans do not show up in the Wiimmfi Bans List (which means the expiration date is unknown) so we highly recommend to use the Fix 1 as it is simple, straight-forward and does not delete the progress in your save file.
23922: This game is not supported by Wiimmfi.
23923: This game is known by Wiimmfi but disabled, meaning it is not supported.
42069: You tried to be funny and failed.
50000: Your console cannot find your Network or any Network at all.

Even though this might sound stupid, make sure the settings of your connections are actually saved. This error can also happen when there are no connections saved at all somehow, so might be useful to point this out.

Make sure the settings you have inserted are correct and that there is no configuration set in the slots higher than the one you are using. This error also seems to occur when the Network you are trying to connect to uses a password with an unsupported encryption, like WPA or WPA2. For games that are not DSi Enhanced, please use a Network with a WEP encryption or without a password at all.
50099: Your console cannot find your Network.

Make sure the settings you have inserted are correct and that there is no configuration set in the slots higher than the one you are using. This error also seems to occur when the Network you are trying to connect to uses a password with an unsupported encryption, like WPA or WPA2. For games that are not DSi Enhanced, please use a Network with a WEP encryption or without a password at all.
51099: Your console cannot find your Network.

Make sure the settings you have inserted are correct and that there is no configuration set in the slots higher than the one you are using. This error also seems to occur when the Network you are trying to connect to uses a password with an unsupported encryption, like WPA or WPA2. For games that are not DSi Enhanced, please use a Network with a WEP encryption or without a password at all.
51300: Your connection is overlapping with other channels in your Network.
Fix 1 (Router and some Mobile Hotspots only)

Change the channel of your Network to 1 or 11. If other devices are connected to the same Network, please connect these devices to the 5Ghz Network and leave your console connected to the 2.4Ghz Network.
Sometimes this error gets fixed with time, so you might just want to wait a bit until it "fixes itself".
51301: Your connection is overlapping with other channels in your Network.
Fix 1 (Router and some Mobile Hotspots only)

Change the channel of your Network to 1 or 11. If other devices are connected to the same Network, please connect these devices to the 5Ghz Network and leave your console connected to the 2.4Ghz Network.
51302: Your connection is overlapping with other channels in your Network.
Fix 1 (Router and some Mobile Hotspots only)

Change the channel of your Network to 1 or 11. If other devices are connected to the same Network, please connect these devices to the 5Ghz Network and leave your console connected to the 2.4Ghz Network.
52000: Your DS cannot connect to Wiimmfi. The exact cause is not known, however it is known it is related to your Network.

You should be able to fix this error by using `178.62.43.212` as Primary DNS and `1.1.1.1` (this will connect you to the `Wiimmfi 2` servers, where you can still find players using the normal DNSs and the `Wiimmfi` server).
It has been noted this error can "fix itself" with time, so you might want to wait a bit and try again in another moment.

Follow these steps (they use Windows but this should be possible in other OSs too):
1. Connect your PC to the network you are using for your console.
2. Go to the `Control Panel` and enter `Network and Internet` > `Network and Sharing Center`.
3. From the list of connections, select the one of the Network you are using for your console.
4. Click on `Details`, find the IPv4 Address, Subnet Mask and Gateway of the Network and insert them in the connection settings in your console.
Fix 3 (requires Fix 2 to be done first)
If Fix 2 still does not solve the issue, try setting the IP Address 10 digits higher (for example, `192.168.0.100` becomes `192.168.0.110`).
Fix 4 (requires Fix 2 and 3 to be done first)

If not even Fix 3 fixes the error, it might be that your Network does not support Custom DNSs. Use `s!error 20110` and follow the same exact procedure that is said in the Fix 2 to ultimately fix this problem.

52200: The connection to the servers failed.
Restart your console first. If the error is not fixed, try turning off your Network for 5 seconds to refresh the ports.
52201: The connection to the servers failed.
Restart your console first. If the error is not fixed, try turning off your Network for 5 seconds to refresh the ports.
60000: A Friend Roaster with friends saved with another server is being used.
Go to the Friends Roaster and remove all of your friends. In Mario Kart DS the Roaster can be accessed from the title menu, by going to `Records` and then `Friends`.
61020: Your DS got disconnected from Wiimmfi for no apparent reason.
Reconnect again and it should be fine. If you still get the error after 5 tries, check the status of the server you are using as it might be down.
61070: Your DS got disconnected from Wiimmfi for no apparent reason.
Reconnect again and it should be fine. If you still get the error after 5 tries, check the status of the server you are using as it might be down.
61102: Your DS could not connect to Wiimmfi for unknown reasons.
Reconnect again and it should be fine. If you still get the error after 5 tries, check the status of the server you are using as it might be down.
69420: You tried to be funny and failed.
71010: A Friend Roaster with friends saved with another server is being used.
Go to the Friends Roaster and remove all of your friends. In Mario Kart DS the Roaster can be accessed from the title menu, by going to `Records` and then `Friends`.

Reconnect again and it should be fine. If you still get the error after 5 tries, check the status of the server you are using as it might be down.

85030: Your DS got disconnected from Wiimmfi for no apparent reason.

86020: Reconnect again and it should be fine. If you still get the error after 5 tries, check the status of the server you are using as it might be down.
86420: Your Network cannot establish P2P connections as host or as both host and guest. Be ready for some headaches, because it is very tedious to fix. It also cannot be fixed from a Mobile Hotspot, unless you have access to Port Forwarding which is not accessible for 99% of the phones.
Check the Firewall of your OS and make sure your PC is not blocking the connection to the server you are using.
Fix 2 (recommended, safe and router-only, requires Fix 1 to be done first if using an emulator)
Access the settings of your router (you might need to check Advanced Settings too) and make sure your Firewall is not blocking the connection to Wiimmfi.
Fix 3 (recommended, safe and router-only, requires Fix 2 to be done first)

Access the settings of your router (you might need to check Advanced Settings too). The procedure depends by router and router, so I will try to use common terms and synonyms when possible. First of all disable uPnP and make sure NAT is enabled. Then, look for a Port Forwarding, NAT or PAT option, which should prompt a table (if there is something that disables this table, please enable it). Add a new value (a port) to the table: enter `1024` for internal port and `65535` for external port, and for the type of port select `TCP&UPD`, if not present, just `UPD`. Make another port and follow the same procedure, just switch `1024` for external port and `65535` for internal port.

This should fix the problem, but you might want to whitelist your console to this rule (through Static IP Address or MAC) for security reasons.
Fix 4 (unsafe and router-only, requires Fix 1 to be done first if using en emulator)

Access the settings of your router (you might need to check Advanced Settings too) and turn on DMZ. This is not a very safe thing to do, but if you are using the router only for your console, then you should be fine.
This error is explained very well in this guide, so if something is not clear, try giving it a read: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1f3PChwQig40UaiPXlh-Gi5CggGiBPzyrpiecLZlT8ZE/edit?usp=sharing.
87001: Congratulations! This is a very rare error that only very few people got! And not even Wiimmfi devs know what causes this so if you constantly get it, good luck finding a fix!

Jokes apart, the fact it is a rare error and the cause is unknown is true, so try to refresh your Network by restarting it, try to restart your console, make sure all of the settings are correct, make sure your Friend Roaster is empty, etc..
